Two important areas of research are mercury contamination and the proliferation of cyanobacteria. In addition to identification and research, the Institute proposes ways to mitigate the impact of contamination on the Amazonian population. https://t.co/cPPAcKWWyg

In addition to being an important research center for micro-organisms and pathologies in the Amazon, it also has an Environment Department, which researches the environmental impacts in the Amazon region and their effects on the population's health. https://t.co/khdc9QySNa

Vice-President @GeneralMourao led a diplomatic delegation to visit federally managed Instituto Evandro Chagas, founded in 1936. It is a world-renowned scientific institution for the Biological Sciences, Environment and Tropical Medicine, headquartered in the Amazon region. https://t.co/DBmil5Txto

SipamSAR produces deforestation alerts that are made available to environmental inspection bodies such as 
@brasil_IBAMA and @ICMBio in real-time.

@censipam SAR technology is able to see the terrain even under cloud cover. In this way, during the period of heavy rains in the Amazon - which lasts about eight months - the radar is able to monitor deforestation. https://t.co/JASswx1zFb

The Brazilian government, through @censipam, has developed a system for monitoring deforestation in the Amazon called SipamSAR. The system uses synthetic aperture radar aboard satellites to monitor the earth's surface. https://t.co/mfWp3axDDQ

6. This measure has been emitted as a result of ongoing concern with actions taken by social media groups that have been perceived as harmful to healthy debate and freedom of expression in Brazil, and hope it will serve to help restore online political dialogue in the country.
5. Attention: the law does not prevent the social network from removing content that violates Brazilian law, such as child pornography. The Brazilian government stands for both freedom and democracy!

4. This measure forbids selective deplatforming by requiring that social media provide a just cause for the suspension of services and restore access should the suspension be considered unlawful. This measure is based on precedent in Brazilian law and freedom of expression.

3. It is also guaranteed that the social network will have to justify the removal of content under the terms of Brazilian laws. Without a just cause, the social network will have to restore the removed content.

2. The Provisional Measure issued today by the Brazilian government forbids the removal of content that may result in any kind of "censorship of political, ideological, scientific, artistic or religious order".
1. Brazilian government is taking the global lead in defending free speech on social networks and protecting the right of citizens to freedom of thought and expression. https://t.co/FEimY8DchZ

The Ruins of S√£o Miguel das Miss√µes are one of the most emblematic symbols of the period of Jesuit reductions. The site was part of the history of indoctrination and catechizing of indigenous population of the region. The site still receives several visitors.

Part of the touristic route in Brazil are the Ruins of S√£o Miguel, the Guarani Village, the Missions Museum, the Cruz Missioneira, the Fazenda da Laje, the Fonte Missioneira, the Missionary Memory Point and the Porch written in Guarani - "this land has owner".

These missions had great impact in and around Brazil. Jesuit priests passed through the lands of South America spreading Christianity. The places where these missions happened are old buildings that contrast with the local nature. Must-visit sites full of history of our peoples.

#DidYouKnow that the Jesuit Missions Corridor was classified by @the_idb as one of the largest in the world? The set of destinations is comparable to the historical and cultural weight of the Silk Route, Trans-Siberian Railroad and American Route 66.

This project is supported by the @the_idb, which has provided a US$ 500 thousand investments for the development of a series of measures to strengthen the routes, such as the creation of a website and the selection of proposes elaborated by SMEs, startups and microentrepreneurs.

The tour connects 19 destinations that mark the history of colonization for mission areas in the region, all of them recognized by @Unesco as world heritage sites. Not to mention 7 protected areas. The implementation of the actions has a deadline for October 2020.

Wondering where to go in South America? Brazil, Argentina, Uruguay, Paraguay and Bolivia have joined efforts to create a whole new experience for tourists by implementing an integrated guide tour about jesuit reductions. https://t.co/BBElqQVAFk

.@MichelTemer: "A country that, in the face of isolationism, proposes more openness and integration. That, faced with intolerance, proposes more dialogue and solidarity. That, in the face of unilateralism, proposes more diplomacy and multilateralism." #UNGA #BrazilAtUN
.@MichelTemer: "The members of this General Assembly know that they have and will always have, in Brazil, a firm ally of cooperation among nations." #UNGA #BrazilAtUN

.@MichelTemer: "Diplomacy and multilateralism are also decisive instruments for global security - this is what the @UN peace missions show, in which Brazil is proud to play a major role." #UNGA #BrazilAtUN
.@MichelTemer: "In two years, we have doubled the total of the preservation areas in Brazil." #UNGA #BrazilAtUN

.@MichelTemer: "On the occasion of the World Water Forum, which we hosted in Brasilia, we established, in the Brazilian seas, areas of preservation of the dimension of the territories of Germany and France added." #UNGA #BrazilAtUN
.@MichelTemer: "We have created and expanded environmental conservation units in Brazil, which currently correspond to more than four times the territory of Norway." #UNGA #BrazilAtUN

.@MichelTemer: "Our efforts to reduce deforestation have been intense. The long-term trend is encouraging. Today, in the Brazilian Amazon, deforestation rates are 75% lower than in 2004." #UNGA #BrazilAtUN

.@MichelTemer: "We are fully engaged in moving towards a low carbon international economy. More than 40% of Brazil's energy matrix is clean and renewable - one of the most sustainable in the world." #UNGA #BrazilAtUN https://t.co/ojfunzunLT

.@MichelTemer: "In recent years alone we have negotiated the 2030 Agenda and the Paris Agreement. Those are real milestones, which put us on the path of economic growth with social justice and respect for the environment." #UNGA #BrazilAtUN
.@MichelTemer: "Finally, the challenge of unilateralism. We respond to it with more diplomacy, more multilateralism." #UNGA #BrazilAtUN
.@MichelTemer: "I reaffirm that it is with dialogue and solidarity that we will overcome intolerance, that we will build peace." #UNGA #BrazilAtUN
.@MichelTemer: "In 2017 alone we have donated about a ton of medicines and vaccines for the benefit of children affected by the conflict. We have also received a large number of refugees."
.@MichelTemer: "We also support international efforts to end the conflict in Syria, which has been going on for too long. We have sought to help mitigate so much suffering."

.@MichelTemer: "In this year in which we associate ourselves with celebrations for the 70 years of Israel, Brazil renews its support for the solution of two states - Israel and Palestine - living side by side in peace and security."
.@MichelTemer: "If dialogue and solidarity are antidotes to intolerance, they are also the raw material of lasting peace."
.@MichelTemer: "We have expanded rights and cut red tape on requirements for entry and stay in Brazil."

.@Micheltemer: "Faithful to this tradition, we instituted last year a new Migration Law - a modern law that not only protects the dignity of the immigrant, but recognizes the benefits of immigration."
.@MichelTemer: "In Brazil, we are proud of our welcoming tradition. We are a people forged in diversity. There is a piece of the world in every Brazilian." https://t.co/IoJTpxEAOC

.@MichelTemer: "We have promoted their resettlement to other regions of Brazil. We issue documents that enable them to work in the country. We offer school for children, vaccination and health services for all."

.@MichelTemer: "Brazil has received all those who come to our territory. There are tens of thousands of Venezuelans whom we seek to give our full assistance. With the collaboration of the High Commission for Refugees, we built shelters to support them in the best way."

.@MichelTemer: "In Latin America, Brazil has been working to preserve democracy and human rights. We will continue, along with so many other countries, beside peoples who have suffered so much." https://t.co/kpZpfwVl2P

.@MichelTemer: "In the name of human rights, much has already been done - governments, institutions and individuals acting in the same level as the Brazilian Sergio Vieira de Melo, whose memory I want to honor in these fifteen years of his tragic death."
.@MichelTemer: "Making this document come true, which will soon be seven decades old, is an imperative that demands permanent attention and action."

.@MichelTemer: "Also to the challenge of intolerance, Brazil has responded decisively: with dialogue and solidarity. Dialogue and solidarity inspire us at every moment to honor the Universal Declaration of Human Rights."
.@MichelTemer: "The insulation may even give a false sense of security. Protectionism may even sound seductive. But it is with openness and integration that we achieve harmony, growth, progress."
.@MichelTemer: " It is like this, with openness and integration, that we approach a better future for all."

.@MichelTemer: "Especially productive has been our participation in cooperation forums such as the G20, the BRICS, the Community of Portuguese Speaking Countries. These are spaces where we produce concrete results, with direct impact to the day to day of our societies."

.@MichelTemer: " And we revitalized or started trade negotiations with partners from all regions - European Union, European Free Trade Association, Canada, South Korea, Singapore, Lebanon, Morocco, Tunisia."
.@MichelTemer: "We are moving closer to the countries of the Pacific Alliance, seeking an ever more united Latin America - as, moreover, our Constitution determines."
.@MichelTemer: "In our geographic environment, we have deepened integration mechanisms. In @mercosur, we reaffirm the bloc's democratic vocation, break down trade barriers and sign new agreements."
.@MichelTemer: "This is how Brazil is working. We are pursuing a universalist foreign policy."
.@MichelTemer: "It is in opening to the other - and not in introspection and isolation - that we will build an effectively shared prosperity."
.@MichelTemer:"Isolationism, intolerance, unilateralism: for each one of these tendencies, we have to respond with what our peoples have the best."

.@MichelTemer: "But if we want to improve our collective order, we still have another task: to defend the very integrity of that order. Order that, however imperfect it may be, has served the greater causes of humanity."
